page.title: 15Farming
page.content: {Newnham Farm}was mentioned in the first{Domesday Book}It consists of 284 acres of mainly arable farmland and 36 acres of woodland. {Kemphill Farm}now includes{Pondcast {Farm.}There are 200 acres of pasture for over 100 Friesian cows but because of reduced milking quotas part of the land now grows wheat and barley. {Chillingwood Farm}consists of 48 acres of grassland and specialises in pedigree Suffolk sheep and fat lamb production. {Rowlands Farm}is part of a complex of 850 acres. The land produces cereal crops, potatoes and peas. {Coppid Hall}(140 acres) and Longcommon are both dairy farms. Coppid Hall pasteurises its own milk and supplies the Ryde area. The workforce has been reduced to an average of one labourer per farm.
